page.title: 01Rural area near Gatwick
page.content: A predominately agricultural area between two villages and near Gatwick Airport,Crawley and other towns. Oak trees in the hedgerows dominate the scenery. There is considerable patch woodland cover of mixed woodland and hornbeam. Deer are stillevident. Farming is mainly dairy and beef, with winter grazing of sheep. Some farms are 200-300 acres but most are much smaller. There is increasing horseyculture, some fruit farming,t wo farm shops. Housing is very varied, some excellent timberframed houses up to 500 years old. Nar the vilages is some ribbon development, houses of all types and quality. Ugly sheds, stables and farm buildings (for which no planning permission is requied) are constantly appearing. Planning pressures here are very considerable (employment prospects are good and
